article:
I used to find notes left in the church's collection basket, beautiful notes about my homilies  and about the writer's thoughts on the daily readings.The  _  fascinated me, but it was a long time  _  I met the author of the notes.
One Sunday morning, I was  _  hat someone was waiting for me in the office, a young woman who said she  _  all the notes. When I saw her I was  _  , since I had no idea that it was she who wrote the notes.She was sitting in a chair in the office.Her  _  was bowed and when she raised it to look at me, she could barely  _  without pain. Her face was disfigured , so smiling was very  _  for her.
We  _  for a while that Sunday morning and agreed to meet for lunch later that week.
As it  turned out  , we went to lunch several times and told each other about our  _  .We spoke of authors we had both  _  , and it was easy to tell that  _  were a great love of hers.
She suffered from a disfigurement that cannot be made to look  _  .I know that her condition  _  her deeply.Yet there was beauty to her that had nothing to do with  _  .She was one to be listened to, whose words came from a wounded but  _  heart. She possessed a fine tuned sense of beauty.Her only  _  in life was the loss of a frien
The truth of her life was a desire to see beyond the  _  for a glimpse of what it is that matters.She found beauty and  _  and they befriended her, and showed her what is real.
